short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: A simplistic tab manager, syncs all tabs and groups with your bookmarks

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Tabbouleh is a tab manager for Chrome. Instead of managing dozens of tabs in one window, split them into sessions. All your sessions are saved to a dedicated folder in your bookmarks.

What it does:

* It lets you save all your tabs and groups as a session. 
* You can create as many sessions as you want (simply open a new window and save it by clicking the "Save current session" button).
* In order to switch to a session - simply click it via the Tabbouleh extension menu. This will close your current session/window and open the chosen session.
* In order to open a session in a new window, without closing the current one, simply middle-click the session.

* It also closes duplicate tabs automatically to reduce clutter (this functionality can be turned off via the Tabbouleh extension menu)

What it doesn't do:

* It doesn't track your browsing history.
* It doesn't rely on a server. Everything happens in your browser.
* It doesn't share your information with a 3rd party.
